input.description: adapter name [Optional] The name of the adapter that is enabled on the Peer. The default adapter name is IBMTSMActor

FIND SCHEDULE:
This wrapper displays information about one or more schedules.
Sample Item Xml:
<items> <item> <operation-name>find-schedule</operation-name> <timeout-secs>30</timeout-secs> <command-options> <domain-name>standard</domain-name> <schedule-name>schedule00001</schedule-name> <type>client</type> <nodes-name>shyam,vikasm</nodes-name> <format>detailed</format> </command-options> </item> </items>
Elements Description:
operation-name [Required]: the operation name. Valid values: find-schedule.
timeout-secs [optional]: the time out second. the unit of this parameter is "second". Valid value: any integer greater than 0; Default value: 60.
command-options [Required]: within this element we provide the informations (elements) such as <domain-name>, <schedule-name>, <options> etc.
domain-name [Optional]: Specifies the name of the policy domain to which the schedule belongs.
Valid values: The domain-name of targeted schedule, wildcard character "*". Default value: All domains would be selected (logical ANDing.)
schedule-name [Optional]: Specifies the name of the schedule that belongs to the specified policy domain. If you specify a schedule name, you must also specify a policy domain name.
Valid values: The schedule-name of targeted schedule, wildcard character "*". Default value: All schedules would be selected (logical ANDing.)
type [Optional]: Specifies that the query displays client schedules.
Valid values: Client. Default value: Client.
nodes-name [Optional]: Specifies the name of one or more client nodes that are associated with the schedules to be displayed. If you do not specify a client name, all schedules matching the domain-name and schedule-name parameters are displayed. You can specify multiple client nodes by separating the names with commas and no intervening spaces.
Valid vlaues: nodes' name of targeted schedule, to whom the targeted schedule is associated; wildcard character "*".
Note: if we don't provide this element then the response don't carry the associated node(s) detail.
format [Optional]: Specifies how information is displayed.
Valid values: Standard, Detailed.
Standard Specifies that partial information is displayed for the schedules. Detailed Specifies that detailed information is displayed for the schedules.
Default value: Standard.

documentation.description: This wrapper displays information about one or more schedules.
